title: MLB.TV Feeds
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Videos tab (or view)

custom_steps_separated.content: and feeds available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the MLB.TV Broadcasts header
and the feeds available (<Team>: <Call Letters>)

custom_steps_separated.content: and no feeds available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the MLB.TV Broadcasts header

title: No Highlights
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Videos tab (or view)
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the Highlights header
and underneath the messaging that 'No highlights currently available'

title: Highlights - Paid
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Videos tab (or view)
and highlights are available for a game
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the Highlights header
and highlight cell for each available highlight

title: Highlights - Lite
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a lite user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and a taps on the Videos tab (or view)
and highlights are available for a game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a highlight thumbnail
and headline
and duration | highlight date
and on iPhone a Play button in the upper left

title: Badge - Unwatched
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and there are highlights available for the game
and the user views the Videos tab
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a red badge
and the number in the badge corresponds to the unwatched highlights

title: Indicator - Unwatched
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and there are highlights available for the game
and the user taps on the Videos tab (or view)
custom_expected: Then the user should see a indicator dotting the bottom left for all highlights unwatched

title: Sharing
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and there are highlights available for the game
and taps on the Videos tab

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user taps on a Video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the video will play in full screen
and the Video Share button will be present for Shareable highlights

<keyword type="mmtax" value="shareable"/>

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user taps on the Share button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the video will pause
and the user will see the Share sheet

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user taps on a Share method (Facebook, iMessage, E-mail, Twitter)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Share method flow will occurs

Check each Share method

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user finishes the sharing the highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the video will continue until completion
or the user can tap on Done

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user checks the Share method
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user specific highlight will be viable

Check each Share method

title: Highlight Cell
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Videos tab (or view)
and highlights are available for a game
and views the highlight cell for a cell
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a highlight thumbnail
and headline
and duration | highlight date
and on iPhone a Play button in the upper left

title: Watch a Highlight
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and there are highlights available for the game
and the user views the Videos tab

custom_steps_separated.content: and taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the corresponding video should play in full screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
and the video completes
or the user taps on Done
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user returns the user to Gameday Videos view

custom_steps_separated.content:
and the video completes
or the user taps on Done
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the indicator dot should be removed from that Video cell for that highlight only

custom_steps_separated.content:
and the video completes
or the user taps on Done
custom_steps_separated.expected: and the badge on the Video tab (or view header) should be decreased by 1

title: Videos (Final)
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user taps on a game in Final from Scoreboard and Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: and the game has a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user can see MLB.TV Broadcasts header
and see the archive feed(s) available
and the text Archive

custom_steps_separated.content: and the game has Wrap highlights
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user can see Wrap header
and the user can see Condensed Game
and the user can see Game Recap
and the duration is displayed for both
and unwatched indicator is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and the game has in-game highlights
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user can see Highlights header
and the user can see game highlights
and unwatched indicator is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and when a user taps on a video from the Wrap or Highlights sections
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the unwatched indicator is removed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Video Tab for a live game that has highlights
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the videos tab
And the user should see either a default thumbnail image or placeholder thumbnails for each video

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user taps on the Video Tab for a live game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will NOT be gated and will be able to view the tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video should play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a pre-roll ad play before the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user changes the language on the device to something other than English/Spanish
And the user taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video should play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can play video across network conditions
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Check on Carrier/Wifi
Check on low bandwidth

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify video cell display
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Each video should have:

Thumbnail with Play button
Blurb underneath thumbnail

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a Gameday audio stream
And the user begins playing a video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio stream should pause
And the video should begin to play
And the user should be able to see and hear the video stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing an audio stream from another application
And the user begins playing a video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio stream should pause
And the video should begin to play
And the user should be able to see and hear the video stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a video
And the user receives and answers a phone call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The the video should stop
And when the user answers the phone call the video should not begin to play again

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a video
And the user receives a text message or other notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be able to hear the alert
And the video should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a video
And an alarm goes off on the device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Video will pause briefly
And we will successfully receive the alarm
And the Video will continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Video tab
And new videos are published to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The the tab should refresh
And the new videos should appear
And the user should not need to leave the tab to see new videos appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the video section during a live game
And there are no highlights available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see a message saying "No videos available"

title: Game Preview
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is on an iPhone
and views a Game Preview
and the game has an editorial game preview published
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the editorial content in-between the game links and lineups
and the user will see preview image related to the game or probable pitcher
and a headline text under the bottom of the image
and a preview blurb with a More button
and tapping the image or blurb or More will open the Preview Article

title: Game Preview - Swipe
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a Game in Preview 
and pre game content has been added (Probables, Lineups, Preview)
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to swipe the Game Preview
and all the content is visible

title: Game Preview Article - Swipe
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed
and taps on a Game in a Preview state
and taps on the game preview article
custom_steps: When a user swipes back from the article to the game preview
custom_expected:
Then user should be returned to the game preview
and the position should be retained
and the user should not be jumped to the top of the view

title: Game Wrap
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user taps on a game in Final from Team Page or Scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the Wrap tab (or view)
and not the Pitch by Pitch tab (or view)
and see Box Score, Summary, and Videos tabs (or view)

title: Wrap
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in Final
and taps on Wrap view
and a Game Wrap has been published by Editorial
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the away team and home team
and game score, team logos, records, venue
and the matchup image (team logos or a game image)
and headline and blurb
and the additional information game (Umpires, Weather, Wind, Start Time)

title: Recap Article
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When user taps on a game in Final
and game has a Recap Article published by Editorial
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a Game Recap link
and tapping on Game Recap will open the article in a modal 
and the user can swipe through the article
and play any videos
and tapping on Done will bring the user back to the Game Wrap

title: Wrap Video
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in Final from Scoreboard or Team Page
and the game has a Game Wrap published by Editorial
and a video
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a Play button in the upper left
and a image thumbnail
and tapping on the entire image plays a video inline
and the user can swipe the the Game Wrap content

title: Wrap - Swipe
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in Final
and post game content added
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to swipe the Game Wrap
and all the post game data is visible

title: Recap Article - Swipe
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed
and taps on a Game in a Final state
and taps on the game recap article
custom_steps: When a user swipes back from the article to the game wrap
custom_expected:
Then user should be returned to the game wrap
and the position should be retained
and the user should not be jumped to the top of the view

title: Lineups in Preview
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is viewing a Game Preview

custom_steps_separated.content: and no lineups are set for either team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see a LINEUPS header
and 'LINEUPS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE' displayed once on iPhone
and 'LINEUPS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE' displayed under each team column

custom_steps_separated.content: and a lineup is set for the away team only
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the lineup for the away team (left)
and 'LINEUPS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE' text for the home team (right)

custom_steps_separated.content: and a lineup is set for the home team only
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the lineup for the home team (right)
and 'LINEUPS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE' text for the away team (left)

custom_steps_separated.content: and lineups are for both teams
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see LINEUPS header
and the text (Subject to Change) 
and the lineups for both teams 
and team logo will be displayed as a watermark and centered behind the team's lineup

custom_steps_separated.content:
and the user is viewing the lineup column
and the ballpark is an AL park (or a game with a DH)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see Team Name
and a Player and Position header
and then 10 rows of data
and see Batting Order, Player Name, Batting Side (L or R or S), Position
and a dash for the starting pitching in the 10th row (name and position only)

custom_steps_separated.content:
and the user is viewing the lineup column
and the ballpark is an NL park (or a game without a DH)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see Team Name
and a Player and Position header
and then 9 rows of data
and see Batting Order, Player Name, Batting Side (L or R or S), Position

title: Gameday Live Segment
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from the Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
custom_expected:
Then then the user should see a segment
and the left segment is the away team (teamName)
and the right segment is the home team (teamName)

title: Lineup
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a segment controller
and the segment (teamName) should match team name (name)
and header for Lineup
and lineup from 1 to 9 (Last Name, Position)

title: Lineup Stats
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and views the data next to the players name
custom_expected:
Then the user should the player's position (P)
and the batting side (B)
and the H-AB for the game
and the HR, RBI, SB for the game (only if it is greater than 0)

title: Bench
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and swipes past the Lineup header
custom_expected:
Then the user should see Bench header
and see the position players available on the bench (Last Name, Bat Side)

title: Bench Stats
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and swipes to the Bench header
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the season stats for the bench players:
POS, B, AVG, AB, HR, RBI, SB

title: Bullpen
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and swipes past the Lineup header
and swipes past the Bench header
custom_expected:
Then the user should see Bench header
and see the bullpen pitchers available (Last Name, Pitch Hand)

title: Bullpen Stats
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and swipes to the Bullpen header
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the season stats for the bullpen pitchers:
POS, T, W-L, ERA, SV, IP, BB/SO

title: Player Card
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a game in progress from the Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
and taps on a player

custom_steps_separated.content: on iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the correct player card is launched as a popover
and tapping off the popover dismisses the player card

custom_steps_separated.content: on iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the correct player card is pushed on (with Back arrow)
and the user is able to swipe back
or tap on the back arrow to return to the Field view

title: Current Batter
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and then swipes to the Lineups view
custom_expected: Then the user should see the current batter of the current inning highlighted

title: Lineup Headers
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a taps on a game in progress from Scoreboard or Team Page
and taps on the Gameday (or Pitch-by-Pitch) view
and swipes to the Lineups view
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the following header/row
POS for position
B for bats   
H-AB for hits-at bats
Summary

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Preview page for a game in a Preview state
and the lineups are available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Preview page of Gameday
and there should be tabs for Lineups and Matchup right underneath the game info
with Lineups as the default selected tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Preview page for a game in a Preview state
and the lineups are not yet available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Preview page of Gameday
and the matchup info will be listed underneath the probable pitchers 
but only if there are probable pitchers listed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Lineups tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the home and away teams' lineups
and there should be two tabs available: Standard and Statcast
with Standard selected as the default

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Standard tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the lineup data will be listed in Standard categories

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Statcast tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the lineup data will be listed in Statcast categories
and there should be a key for the category abbreviations available at the bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Matchup tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the matchup info for batters vs the probable pitchers

title: Probable Pitchers
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is viewing a Game Preview

custom_steps_separated.content: and no probables pitchers are set for either team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see TBD and no stats displayed for both teams
and on iPad will display default MLB.com image
and on iPhone will display default player headshot

custom_steps_separated.content: and a probable pitcher is set for the away team only
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see TBD and no stats for home team (right)
and the user will see the probable pitcher for the away team (left)

custom_steps_separated.content: and a probable pitcher is set for the home team only
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see TBD and no stats for away team (left)
and the user will see the probable pitcher for the home team (right)

custom_steps_separated.content: and probable pitchers are set for both teams
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see probable pitcher for both teams 
and handness (LHP, RHP) and number will be displayed
and the current stats (W-L, ERA) and headshot will be displayed on iPhone
and current stats (W-L, ERA, K) and editorial report and action shot will be displayed on iPad
